website_summaries.verdict: Professional-grade power at an entry-level price point. Both pro handymen and casual users give it favorable reviews.
pros: Two-finger trigger allows user to control speed
For casual users, it's an affordable alternative to high-end models
cons: Actual hammering power varies, according to some
Location of chuck key could present hazard

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I've burnt up many masonry bits in my life trying to drill small holes in concrete or masonry block. I was attempting to do this using a standard drill. I finally decided to buy a hammer drill for a project I am doing in my home. This little drill worked like a charm! I hated buying another single use or seldom used tool but this drill didn't cost much more than the price of a rental so I bought it. This drill worked fine for what I needed and I'm glad I made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Angler

customer_reviews.title: Terrible hammer drill, fine for standard drill applications.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a few other Skil products and expected this tonfollow their lead- reasonable price, good value Unfortunately, after only 4 holes through concrete with a Tapcon bit, the motor of this drill started sparking and anxious smell came from the casing. Dropping back to standard drill mode eliminated the sparks and odor, but didn’t allow me to drill into concrete- the reason I bought the drill! Construction seems solid, but performance doesn’t follow the illusion of a quality build
customer_reviews.author: redcoates

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great drill. Used to hang heavy duty shelving in my garage which required drilling into concrete. This drill, combined with good masonry bits, ate the concrete for breakfast. I was also able to quickly torque bolts into the wall using standard nut driver bits. Very powerful and sturdy. The handle can be adjusted to any position. The keyed chuck is reassuring and reliable. The only negative would be the short power cord. That can be mitigated by using an extension cord of course.
customer_reviews.author: palm guru

customer_reviews.title: Great value for DIY, light-duty.
customer_reviews.text: Not for pros! Good for DIY. It does exactly what I need. Infrequent use, light duty, good value. Drills 3/8" holes in aggregate no problem. I was kind of surprised that the hammer action is so subtle -- its more like a vibration than a hammer, which makes it easy on the wrists. I suspect that anyone doing a lot of work won't like this, because the handle/depth-gauge is fiddly and overall impression is somewhat lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: John Lilley

customer_reviews.title: No good, returned because start smoking from drilling first small ...
customer_reviews.text: No good, returned because start smoking from drilling first small hole. Spend a little more money and bought Bosch-works perfectly on small and big holes. Drilled about 50 holes-no problems. Don't buy this model SKILL-total waist of money and your time.
customer_reviews.author: Henrich

customer_reviews.title: Best $50 you'll ever spend
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this drill can't be beat. Arrived a few days before Hurricane Irma hit, and got a workout by myself and all the neighbors putting up their shutters. Plenty of power. Drilled through cured 30yr old concrete / block like butter.
customer_reviews.author: M. Emanuel

customer_reviews.title: Chews through bits quickly, better off getting SDS hammer drill
customer_reviews.text: Finishing the basement required drilling holes in the concrete in some places. Originally started with the Skil 6445-04. I ate through several drill bits, costing more than the drill itself for only 50 holes or so. In the end I gave up and went for a Bauer 1641E-B for about 100 bucks. The Bauer drills holes in 5 seconds at a depth of 2 inches. The Skil was taking 2 minutes, with breaks, using the same exact drill bit. I regret buying the Skil. Any SDS drill will work much better that this at drilling into concrete.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and strong
customer_reviews.text: I needed to drill some holes in my concrete slab. So I went to the Home Depot for renting a hammer drill. Well, they charge more for 4 hours than a reasonably priced new machine would cost. Ergo, purchasing was the way to go. Since I needed it for a more or less one-time job, I went with this Skil hammer drill, not expecting too much for the price... Wow, it it a sturdy, strong machine. Drilled my holes with ease, and now it made already the round in my entire neighborhood. So far, it stood up to any demand.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: one and a half years it no longer goes in reverse
customer_reviews.text: I was generally satisfied with this drill up to the point in time that it no longer would go into reverse mode. It still works in forward mode, and drills strongly in that direction. Unfortunately the manufacturers warranty is only for one year, and I did used a Amazon gift card instead of a CC with extended warranty protection. I don't abuse my tools, and the drill this one replaced I had for close to 30 years - I kind of expected more than 1 1/2 years homeowner use.
customer_reviews.author: Bob of Will Hills

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, full-featured, solidly built - terrific value
customer_reviews.text: Beyond my title there's not much more to say. I'm not a pro so can't judge this against the competition, nor for extended use etc. I just see it as a solid power tool that will cut through my limited jobs with ease. What a piece of machinery for $40 !! I think it would have cost the same 40 years ago. Don't see how an average user can go wrong with this. If you need a hammer drill for "homeowner" type jobs, this is plenty good.
customer_reviews.author: Raknox

customer_reviews.title: MORE POWER!!!
customer_reviews.text: Yeah!!! I got some feathers and wedges and wanted to use them to bust up some stupid rocks sticking out all over my yards. My regular drill and even regular cordless hammer drill weren't cutting it, literally. This thing ROCKS! HA Get it? Cause I needed to use it on rocks? Ahem. Anyhow. This drill isn't expensive. It's a good quality drill - feels well made and feels great to use. The bit takes the large 1/2" bits I have. It TEARS through rocks! It is also SUPER LOUD! WEAR EAR PROTECTION!! But boy oh boy this thing is a beast! I can now drill through ANYTHING I come across here! What's next? Who wants some!??!!?
customer_reviews.author: Steve K

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I just drilled 20 holes 3 inches deep into cinder block foundation. This drill handled it well and fast. It uses a regular shank bit rather than a hammer shank. I ordered a hammer drill bit which didn't quite fit right and caused a little off centered wobbling. So make sure you use a regular shank bit. The hammer bit has 4 slots. The depth guage is a nice feature. It was about the same cost as a 1 day rental but now I own this drill.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy Jane

customer_reviews.title: Good drill for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good hammer drill for a DIY. I used it with an ordinary masonry bit to drill into a concrete foundation, and it handled the job with ease. However, consistent with its low $40 price, it is not made for a heavy duty construction environment. Therefore, I would recommend the drill to a handyman for light to medium jobs but would not recommend it for a professional on job sites. By the way, the chuck worked fine, did not loosen up, and the drill had plenty of power. In addition, the handle provided adequate support and was easy to to install on the drill.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn K.

customer_reviews.title: Smoked and quit
customer_reviews.text: I've used my drill very seldom, maybe 3 or 4 times. I'm not a professional so the usage is light. My drill smoked and won't work. Now skil won't replace it because it's out of warranty. To get a "chance at an exception" I have to register. I asked to determine if they would replace and if they would I would register. They wouldn't. So because my drill didn't burn up within the time period of warranty because I didn't use it then, I'm out unless I forfeit a bunch of my time, and even then they may not replace it. As such I'll know better in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: A hammer drill makes all the difference....
customer_reviews.text: I used my trusty Porter Cable still that I have had for over 6 years with a 3/16 masonry bit to hang a Arlo camera on brick. This process took me forever so I ordered this SKIL drill and had it in 2 days thanks to prime. The porter cable ( not being a hammer drill ) took about 25 min to drill the 3/16 hole that was about 1” deep in brick. This hammer did the job in about 45 seconds. The only thing is this drill is not a keyless chuck so takes a few more seconds to change bits but luckily I didn’t have to change any bits. Great job on this fantastic drill SKIL.
customer_reviews.author: B Cash

customer_reviews.title: Good hammer drill for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a great hammer drill for the bucks. I've used it a good bit in my project. Like any drill, it does what it does best when the bits are sharp. Most people drill a few holes and then find that the carbide bits get dull and when that happens then the drilling gets tough. I'm able to sharpen my carbide bits when they start to slow down and this not only extends the life of the bit, but it also puts less stress on the drill and much less stress on me. This is a good drill.
customer_reviews.author: Katrael

customer_reviews.title: Failed in less than 5 minutes of use
customer_reviews.text: I have several drills but I bought this one specifically for drilling in concrete. I used it a few times to drill 20 3/16 holes for tapcons and then put away for a few years. Was using today to drill a few holes to dowel rebar into an existing slab edge and it went out after 3 holes. Big spark from brushes and it was done. I was not using it very hard and it was cool to touch after (20 degrees f outside.) I need a drill that has a longer life than 5 minutes of drilling total.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: A steal for the price
customer_reviews.text: I had two jobs of installing hand rails at the front and back of my house. Both would be drilling into concrete. Checking Home Depot and Lowes sites I saw rentals started at $25. That would be $50. for my two jobs as the railings were done at different times, coming from different companies. This drill at $40. was a no brainer to buy. It seems strong and with the right bit cut right into the concrete without problem. I didn't need to own a drill of this kind, but it saved me money to buy rather than rent, and now I have one for the next unforeseen job.
customer_reviews.author: Dale H. Stein Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Drilled 5/8 in. holes in steps increasing from 1/2 - Fast
customer_reviews.text: I needed to install a post lamp on a poured concrete slab. This drill arrived today and the post lamp was installed today. I used 3/8 in. lag bolts with 5/8 in. anchors. This drill is rated at no more than 1/2 inch, so I did the three holes in steps. I drilled 3/8 in. holes first just to make sure it was the right depth and all looked good ..., then increased it to 1/2 in., and then increased each hole to 5/8 inch. I've used a regular drill before with masonry bits in concrete blocks or mortar, but it was never so fast as this ... and in poured concrete.
customer_reviews.author: tonymcc

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Another well made Skil product. Used for a home project drilling through both cinder block and concrete. This drill handled both without a hitch. It seems very sturdy and if past experience with Skil products holds true, it should be long lasting. The attached electrical cord appears well made and is longer than many I've seen in comparable products. Only downsides are the relative bulk of the unit (not unexpected in a 7 amp hammer drill) and the fact that it is quite loud when using (also expected). Overall, very satisfied with the quality and performance of this product.
customer_reviews.author: OH Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Used item
customer_reviews.text: Scratched around the handle and cord... Just looks used... The box was even open!
customer_reviews.author: Hawkeye

customer_reviews.title: Spend a little more and get a better hammer drill.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy. Hammer portion did not work out of the box. Only makes a buzzing sound and slight vibration. No difference then a regular drill. Burned up new set of bits trying to drill one hole.
customer_reviews.author: R. Humbert

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Great power for an inexpensive tool. The front handle is adjustable. I've used it to drill though concrete with a 1 inch bit and it chewed it right up with no straining of the motor at all. Ergonomic handle and includes a depth measure for drilling holes of a set depth.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: This drill cost less than the bits your regular drill will eat
customer_reviews.text: I burned up 2 bits on 2 holes in my basement floor with my regular drill and said screw it, I'll order a hammer drill. Now I can see what my options really we're.. 1. Beat myself up for about 15 minutes per hole and eat 50 dollars worth of bits up. 2. Buy a hammer drill for 40 bucks and 1 bit and drill all the holes in less than 2 minutes. Glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Cory D Keena

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't permit you to drill into concrete with SDS bits.
customer_reviews.text: New to home improvement here. I bought a hammerdrill SPECIFICALLY to drill into concrete to fix my house. I bought a masonry bit for drilling concrete and it...didn't quite fit in the chuck. The manual was no help here, so I just used the key to get it to fit...kind of. The bit wobbled 5x the diameter of the bit, tore up the ground, but wouldn't actually make any progress, throwing sparks out the back. Severely dissappointed. Might work as a basic drill if you want a cheap corded drill. Not working for installing tapcon/confast fasteners, using an SDS plus bit.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Robert Roth

customer_reviews.title: Needs better instructions
customer_reviews.text: I know I'm ignorant, but I can't find anywhere that explains how to use the measuring stick. Lots of websites and videos show the stick but nobody explains how to use it in practice. Is it supposed to automatically stop the drill at a certain point? How do you use the engraved numbers? It also took a few minutes to figure out how to attach the front grip.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed to say the least
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed to say the least. Used it maybe three times before it burned out trying to do a simple whole out the side of an older home.
customer_reviews.author: James Ruppaner

customer_reviews.title: I thoroughly enjoy this Hammer drill
customer_reviews.text: Absolute powerhouse. I thoroughly enjoy this Hammer drill. The key attachment next to the cord is very convenient, what a unique way to make up for a non-wireless instrument. Ofcourse not as expensive because you can't run around with it without bring the cord. Does household jobs flawlessly. Feels industrial and well constructed
customer_reviews.author: Jay LeCompte

customer_reviews.title: Powerful drill
customer_reviews.text: The batteries for my old cordless drill died. Instead of feeding the cordless drill beast, I decided to opt for a more powerful corded drill. This Skil drill was the right purchase. It has tons of torque and doesn't have batteries that die. I wish it had different speeds, so you didn't risk drilling too far into your surface. However, overall I'm quite satisfied with my decision to get this drill.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Hammer Drill
customer_reviews.text: Used this drill to install security cameras on cement filled cinder block and what a deference it made from in the past using a regular drill. It's a little heavy at first but I got used to it and the job moved very quickly. This is a great product for the price and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: SDH

customer_reviews.title: Heavy...and Heavy Duty.
customer_reviews.text: Not the lightest drill in the world, but it gets the job done. I will say that I had never owned this type of drill before so I dont have anything to base it on, but it seems pretty powerful and sturdily built. I was using it to drill holes for tapcons at our newly constructed houe, and it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: CharlieBrown

customer_reviews.title: Great for a handy homeowner
customer_reviews.text: So much power! I’m no pro, so can’t judge it based on that, but if you’re a homeowner needing more punch than a cordless, this is a safe bet. I’ve used in for building a chicken coop/run, with an auger attachment to dig holes, and a number of random DIY projects. Holds up well and I have yet to come up against something it can’t easily drill through.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany M.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, spare parts not available.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tool in January 2018. I am 72 years old and hardly used the drill. Occasionally to hung some pictures. Last time I tried to used in April 2019 I noticed lots of sparking inside the drill. Since the drill is out of warranty I opened the cassing and found the carbon brush housing broken. See the picture with the 2 pieceses. The housing is not typical kind off, that you can buy in any repair shop. Therefore I contacted Skil - Bosh manufactur and they are not able to find the part, which I want to purchase in order to repair the drill.
customer_reviews.author: radomir pompl

customer_reviews.title: Hammer drill for basement finishing project
customer_reviews.text: I used the hammer drill function on this drill to drill about 50 holes into my basement concrete slab for tapcon screws. I've used other more expensive hammer drills in the past and this one seems durable enough. It didn't break a sweat and worked flawlessly. You can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Canon Hound

customer_reviews.title: Awesome drill... while it worked
customer_reviews.text: Is able to drill holes in brick, granite, and tile in seconds when a cordless could take me 5-10 minutes per hole! Update: reverse no longer works. Put the toggle switch in reverse, pull the trigger, and nothing. At least forward works which is 95% of what a hammer drills life will be in. Lets hope it doeant get snagged.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: Avoid unless you only have 5 holes to drill
customer_reviews.text: 5 holes drilled then the drill died on the 6th hole. No warning.. That's right... dead. Just like somebody unplugged it. Rented a drill to finish the job which was 3/8" holes in concrete, 2 inches deep.
customer_reviews.author: Steve,  the man...

customer_reviews.title: Great drill at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I actually love this drill. And for the price I would marry it if I weren’t already. Built a pergola and needed to drill anchors into the concrete patio. Very smooth and easy. Mounted a water hose reel and flag pole to the house through stucco and into concrete block very smooth and easy. The drill feel good and quality. Again, and at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C

customer_reviews.title: If you can find a better Hammer Drill at this price buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm just another satisfied customer. I just had to drill a few holes in a 24 year old foundation slab. I bought this drill on the basis of the ratings and at $40, I had to see it work. The drill is very solid and the holes took literally 30 seconds each to drill to depth. Either I have a weak foundation or this is a great drill. I'm going with the later.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Ward

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Collar keeps loosing in hammer drill mode. Very frustrating to have to tighten every 10 seconds
customer_reviews.author: Jmkogh

customer_reviews.title: great for price.
customer_reviews.text: bought this mostly for the "hammer "function as my big old milwaulkee commercial is getting really heavy as I get this advanced case of youth deficiency.While only being needed occasionally,it is still nice to have in the tool box when needed.I'm not sure that this drill would hold up for real strenuous work but I like the light weight for my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: rawhide

customer_reviews.title: Chuck is cheap and wont stay locked
customer_reviews.text: The drill is fine. The chuck is cheap and will not stay locked. Too late to return it so I guess I'll have to put a good chuck on it.
customer_reviews.author: Grumpy442

customer_reviews.title: Loses power
customer_reviews.text: Been using it the past few weeks to mix thin set to lay tile and now it’s finally giving me problems, its smoking after a few seconds of usage and lost 50% of torque . Price was too good to be true, I’ll have to buy a better quality one now. Worked well for the first 4 batches of thinset
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Value
customer_reviews.text: For moderate diy types, this is a great tool to add to your arsenal. Used it today. Flawless. Simple. Solid. For under $40. The way tools should be. If I were a pro, I would spend more, go cordless, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Ken

customer_reviews.title: Basic and cost effective - does the job
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically to drill holes in a concrete floor for purposes of anchoring heavy equipment. It worked very well and I expect to use it as a regular corded drill also... it is a more versatile tool than I thought. Not sure on how well it would hold up to daily heavy use, but seems at least as solid as other Skil brand tools I own. The secondary handle can be repositioned conveniently.
customer_reviews.author: David Deaven

customer_reviews.title: HIGH SPEED UNDER POWERED
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to what someone posted this drill does not have a two speed selector. It uses a variable speed trigger with little gearing so consequently it is way underpowered for heavy drilling such as using a hole saw. You will burn up either the bit or the drill trying to do the balancing act of speed vs torque. I should have listened to my instinct and stuck with the low speed high torque B &D.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Lord

customer_reviews.title: Great drill for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this drill did what I needed. I used it to drill about a dozen 1/2" holes into a slab and concrete piers. Like others have said, you just need a good drill bit and to take your time. The depth gauge and handle loosened up while in use which is why 4 stars only. Just need to keep an eye on it each hole being drilled.
customer_reviews.author: Brad C

customer_reviews.title: Good drill for the price
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a good drill for the price. It does have an issue with bits becoming loose after drilling in concrete even when cranking down on the chuck key. Other than that it works great and is a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Trbo

customer_reviews.title: For the money, this is an excellent drill!
customer_reviews.text: Most good quality electric drills will cost $100 or more. This thing worked flawlessly drilling holes in concrete. I used Dewalt drill bits, so some credit goes to them, but for the price this is a very good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H

customer_reviews.title: Value for money is high
customer_reviews.text: I do not have frequent use for it, have not used it heavily, but I needed it for a certain job. It worked great and seems to have high quality, so much so that it seems to be a great bargain at the price.
customer_reviews.author: Turret-index

customer_reviews.title: Wow. More than I expected for this price.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, half the price of the Ryobi at Home Depot. Well built, powerful, variable speed. Reverse. Includes masonry bits in a case, a hex chuck key and a handle. No carrying case, but you can use the box. No bubble, no level. This drill is 120V.
customer_reviews.author: Don D.

customer_reviews.title: Quality seems decent.  This is 2nd from Amazon, first arrived USED.  Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Drill seems well made for light duty use. I intend to attach a few items to my brick house (flag pole base, mailbox, etc) and drill through some landscape timbers - this will work fine. I probably would buy something more heavy duty for a big job. Take caution, the first time i ordered his item it arrived as a USED tool. I sent it back to Amazon and reordered. 2nd shipment looks better, no scuff marks and such.
customer_reviews.author: Brando Commando

customer_reviews.title: Great Addition to my Shop.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed. Didn’t want battery. Didn’t want keyless chuck. Wanted a corded, Keyed chuck, strong hammer drill. This drill fits the bill exactly. I am very pleased with this strong drill. We will live many years together.
customer_reviews.author: HB Jones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to drill into my masonry walls outside to install security cameras. I'm a woman and my arms aren't very strong so I have to say the hammer drill is a bit heavy but I suppose it has to be to do the work it was built for. I'm happy with my purchase even though I might not ever need to use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Wasted a lot of time trying to install shelves on ...
customer_reviews.text: Wasted a lot of time trying to install shelves on my cement garage walls. Finally broke down and bought this! Made installing a pantry a simple afternoon job. Now, one good look and you can tell this isn't a pro quality tool, but for the average do it yourself homeowner who has to drill through cement once in awhile I don't think you can go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Burchfield

customer_reviews.title: No good for Deep concrete
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not a hammer drill. Useless on deep concrete. Got a dewalt a few years later and it blows this away. I can only imagine how much more powerfull the higher end model would be
customer_reviews.author: Ruben

customer_reviews.title: Disposable junk
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. After only 1 month of use, drill chuck won’t hold a bit. It keeps slipping out no matter how much I tighten. I’ve only drilled about 10 holes. This is a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: kito

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Powerful little guy.
customer_reviews.text: Power you can feel at a price that can't be beat. Skil is a good brand and this drill won't disappoint. I'm sure it will drill through the cinder block wall like a hot knife through butter. Then we'll see how does through butter. Can't beat the price point. Thank Amazon for it.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Anza

customer_reviews.title: My Skill 120 Volt Hammer Drill
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Drill this month 2019 as a hobby tool but i am amaze at the power and what this drill is capable of doing. Will gets the Job done.thinking of buying one go a head.
customer_reviews.author: Edi Will

customer_reviews.title: Great drill for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised with the quality and features of this hammer drill. I used it to drill four 3.5 inch holes in concrete to install 3/8 inch anchor bolts for railing. The holes took about 20 seconds each to drill. I used a quality German made masonry bit. The included side mount auxiliary handle really helped stabilize the drill during operation. The cost to rent a hammer drill locally was the same as purchasing this Skil drill. It was a no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: MSK

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: My 20v dewalt hammer burnt out and I needed a cheap drill to get me by. This thing makes small holes in concrete like butter. I've cored 4 inch holes through siding and wood, it did pretty good. I think too many big holes and it will burn up after awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Faids

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value; Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the price. Hammer drills can be expensive. Didn't come with a carry case but that's ok at that price. Extremely powerful, especially if you're used to cordless drills. A little tricky to control the speed. Really good all purpose drill with depth control and a side handle.
customer_reviews.author: JD Puglisi

customer_reviews.title: Home use only!
customer_reviews.text: This hammer drill will work for home use. Will not last for daily prolonged use on a construction site. Great drill for the DIY!!
customer_reviews.author: BBQ_Varmint

customer_reviews.title: Into brick with no problem!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to drill 4 holes 3/8” into brick for my tv. It got the job done fast! It is loud because of drilling into brick. Don’t try early in the morning like I did. Yes this gets the job done and good value for your money.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Very very best Value!
customer_reviews.text: Do your research and you will buy this drill!! Unbelievable value! Don’t waste your 3x $ for a better name!!! Excellent drill!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: i like skill for value
customer_reviews.text: sparks flying out from first use. stop working after dozen holes. i like skill for value. maybe just a defect. see how skill replaces it. stuck in middle of deck project. sucks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Received broken chuck
customer_reviews.text: I guess I received one where the chuck would not close.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Merritt

customer_reviews.title: Just brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: Price is good, build is solid, performance is great. This feels like a beast in your hands and any task is getting accomplished whether its delicate or destructive.
customer_reviews.author: NEIL H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drill for the average homeowner who needs to drill cinderblock or cement for tapcons.
customer_reviews.text: Works excellent. We needed a new hammer drill for drilling inserts for hurricane shutters and tapcons. Works fine. It is not a a Dewalt but it does the job. So far for occasional use for an average homeowner it does an excellent job.
customer_reviews.author: Capt T

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if I’m just used to cordless now and they are that much better but this is kinda gutless. Not what I’d expect from a 1/2” hammer drill. I didn’t expect it to be great for the price but I stall it out all the time using for a hole day tube notcher.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Sabol

customer_reviews.title: Does the job easily.
customer_reviews.text: This hammerdrill drilled through concrete block with ease using a used bit. A bit heavier than ecpected, but that is good. Expect it to last quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: LilJake

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I used this for drilling into walls to put up hurricane shutters on a house. This drill kept going all weeked without a problem and was fast in hammer mode - the 3 1/4 inch holes for tapcons were done in seconds. Only problem I had was using a tapcon attachment to screw in the tapcons. The drill has too much power for driving tapcons, it broke the head off the first three I tried.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Lyne

customer_reviews.title: Chuck won’t hold bit
customer_reviews.text: This wouldn’t hold a bit even when I cranked the chuck key. Within seconds the bits would loosen and wobble.
customer_reviews.author: joe sank

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this drill to do several projects around the yard and it was helpful, just what was needed. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Nice drill
customer_reviews.text: Great drill at a great price! Needed this for a basement remodel project (drilling into concrete floor) and didn’t want to spend $200 on a cordless top end brand. Did the job with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M

customer_reviews.title: Completely useless as a "hammer" drill
customer_reviews.text: Completely useless as a "hammer" drill. The chuck wouldn't stay tight on the bit when I tried to go through masonry - no matter how much I tightened it, the bit would slip out after about 15 seconds of work. I'm past my 30 day return window (otherwise it would go right back to Amazon), so I'll keep it as a backup to my cordless drill i guess.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Mason

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Works much better than I ever imagined. Really powerful,l and zips through brick quickly and effortlessly. My other 1/2" drill almost wore me out. This one really saved me time and made it easy.
customer_reviews.author: william wideman

customer_reviews.title: Works ok
customer_reviews.text: Works ok. As using as a hammer drill while in the middle of drilling the hammer function just stops. Let go of the trigger and let it stop and then try again and it works. So it’s intermittenting. But it works.
customer_reviews.author: 5cents family

customer_reviews.title: HD hammer drill
customer_reviews.text: HD hammer drill. Great quality. Great price. Just what I was looking for! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: anchorbrak

customer_reviews.title: No Reverse
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in May, 2017 and the reverse gear no longer works. It stopped functioning right in the middle of a project. Disappointing. I should have paid up for a more reliable brand. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Boy

customer_reviews.title: Motor burned out on first use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to mix concrete with a mixing attachment. It mixed about 2 80 pound bags before smoke started pouring out of the casing and stopped working all together. Should have known better with a $40 drill.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Hall

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Does not hold drill, needs to be re tighten every 4 or 5 holes. Frustrating tool.
customer_reviews.author: The Old Soldier

customer_reviews.title: Able to drill holes into the tough and rigid cement ceiling.
customer_reviews.text: It works great that my other drill failed. I was able to drill a tough cement ceiling to hang a new crystal chandelier. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Arnaldo Negron

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable, ergonomic and makes life so much better
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent air hammer. It’s reliable and ergonomic and made my job so much easier. I’d buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: satisfied customer

customer_reviews.title: Price is right
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat the price! Doing basement reno drilling into block wall and cement floors and this drill works perfectly. It will be nice to have around for those random other occasions where I need to drill into masonry. Seems like it would be fine for more regular usage too. Definitely beat the cordless hammer drill I had been borrowing from a neighbor.
customer_reviews.author: Janene

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Drill
customer_reviews.text: If you need a heavy duty drill for an excellent price, then this is the drill to purchase. I needed to drill thru 1/4" of metal and this drill along with a metal drill bit did the job in seconds. You can also use this drill to drill thru hard concrete because it is a hammer drill. I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: 3 years ago I bought this drill and a rigid hammer drill that was $130. Since then the rigid has been serviced 3 different times while being used far less then my skillz drill. I finally just had to replace the skillz drill but it's one of the best hammer drills I've owned regardless of price. I highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the money
customer_reviews.text: I shopped reviews and found this one with excellent reviews. The tool exceeded all expectations, performed Well and did the job.
customer_reviews.author: Ollie's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for drilling 3/16 holes in concrete. It works great for that. There is a little more plastic than I'd like but it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Charles Sewall

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Just used it a little. Works fine. Variable speed hammer drill. I read that the the variable speed didn't work. Mine works fine. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: galaxytruckplane

customer_reviews.title: worked great
customer_reviews.text: had to dill out some old concrete to replace a hose spigot. nice clean quick holes Drilled to set anchors, worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Grey

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This hammer drill did in 5 minutes what my older cordless couldn't do in 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Marsh Rat

customer_reviews.title: Aux handle & depth gauge are one part
customer_reviews.text: Made fast work of drilling through cider block. Minor problem: the aux handle and depth gauge are the same part. If you rotate the aux handle to the most comfortable position, the depth gauge may end up in a awkward spot. Also, you can't use the depth gauge when you remove the aux handle to get into a tight space.
customer_reviews.author: Branch

customer_reviews.title: easy to use and powerful
customer_reviews.text: Had to put up a new porch post and saw this reviewed well. Easy to use, not too much kick in hammer mode, and easily drilled a 3.5" hole in a concrete block. Like the keyed chuck over a twist chuck - holds the bit more securely.
customer_reviews.author: Brian McFadden

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the Money!
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this to drill into concrete to set bolts and it works very well. For the money, you can not beat this product. I looked into renting one and it was just $10 less for the day. Now I have one whenever I need it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Duguid

customer_reviews.title: Cuts through concrete quickly
customer_reviews.text: I agree with what others have said -- this is a great choice for homeowners who need to drill into concrete or brick from time to time. At this low price it's unreasonable to think this is built for professional use.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a drill to mount my work bench to the cement wall and floor. This was perfect..drilled through it like almost warm butter. I have no idea why I even tried with a Normal drill.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Product just dosen't last. Can barely do any projects you want it to be able to do. Both of them smoked out after about an hour of work maybe used for 20 mins run time
customer_reviews.author: Adam G.

customer_reviews.title: Best for the price
customer_reviews.text: Best for the price. I have done multiple dyi projects. Including holes in concrete
customer_reviews.author: Duke360

customer_reviews.title: Skil Great drill
customer_reviews.text: I took it out of the box tried it out Works great , this drill gets with the program . I have another Skil drill its 40 years old still works good , I don't think you can beet this for quality or price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great bargain for top grade tool
customer_reviews.text: I needed a hammer drill. Read tons of reviews and selected this one based on price and that I only need it for yard projects. It's not my full time job merely a hobby. Drilled only 4 holes into brick so far and it barely gets warm. Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

product_meta.title: SKIL 6445-04 7.0 Amp 1/2 In. Hammer Drill
product_meta.description: Style:Hammer DrillThis powerful SKIL 6445-04 7 Amp 1/2 In. corded hammer drill is the ideal tool for tough applications. The 1/2 In. keyed chuck accepts larger diameter bits designed for woodworking and cutting while the side-assist handle provides more support when needed. The variable speed trigger accelerates smoothly from low to high speeds, while the 2-finger trigger with lock-on option gives you even more control.
feature_bullets: Poweful 7.0 amp motor for tough applications
1/2 in. keyed chuck to accept large diameter bits designed for woodworking and cutting
Side assist handle for controlled, accurate drilling
Variable Speed trigger for controlled drilling speed

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars764 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
